channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report E-2023110079
item.description:
Report E-2023110079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from (4) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the pallet and drums due to the vent caps releasing as a possible cause of temperature changes/drum expansion. The four drums in shipment and the impacted pallet were wiped down and neutralized with a vinegar solution. All caps were replaced, and the drums were secured for shipment on. All impacted rags, and the damaged caps were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110224
item.description:
Report E-2023110224

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift incident, approximately 2 ounces of Klean Strip Paint Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor and had dried. The terminal felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and 2 damaged cans were placed into a 5 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Waste was left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110217
item.description:
Report E-2023110217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that 1-32 oz metal can of WELD-ON P-70 PRIMER (UN1993) was punctured with a forklift, releasing 5 oz of product to the trailer floor. It was confirmed terminal personnel were comfortable and capable of cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per the SDS. The impacted can, spent absorbents and PPE were containerized into 1-5 gal metal pail that was staged on-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110047
item.description:
Report E-2023110047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1-oz release of UN1791 from (2) 55-gallon plastic drums impacting the top of the drums only, the cause of the release was the bung caps and the spill was not active. The terminal placed the (2) Drums in the OS&D area, when the contractors arrived the (2) vented bungs were leaking and were replaced with new bung caps. A (1) 10 gal DF with (2) broken bung caps, plastic and pads was created as wasted which was staged and left for the terminal to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023101507

  • City: LENEXA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING GUILDLINES IN DECSION TREE. LEAKER WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023101453
item.description:
Report X-2023101453

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS BEING AUDITED IN THE DMP. AFTER IT WAS AUDITED IT BEGAN TO LEAK WHILE SITTING ON THE AUDIT CART. IT WAS ALREADY IN THE DMP AND WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND PROPERLY DISPOSED OF BY A DESIGNATED RESPONDER.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package tipped over on the IC belt causing a small release of contents. QA was called and the package was placed in the HAZMAT cage for inspection. DescribePack: There are stains under the caps of all 4 bottles indicating a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA for inspection
